questions.text: When facing a major decision, you tend to:

choices.text: Research thoroughly and make a detailed plan
Go with your gut feeling and adapt as needed
Seek advice from trusted friends or family
Feel anxious and delay the decision

questions.text: At a social gathering with mostly strangers, you:

choices.text: Energetically introduce yourself to many people
Find one or two people for deeper conversation
Observe from the sidelines until approached
Leave early to recharge alone

questions.text: When someone shares a problem with you, your first instinct is to:

choices.text: Offer practical solutions and advice
Listen empathetically and validate their feelings
Share a similar experience of your own
Feel uncomfortable and change the subject

questions.text: Your workspace or living space is typically:

choices.text: Meticulously organized with everything in its place
Creatively messy but you know where things are
Functional but not a priority
Often chaotic and causes you stress

questions.text: When learning something new, you prefer to:

choices.text: Dive in and experiment through trial and error
Follow a structured course or curriculum
Learn alongside others in a group setting
Take your time and master fundamentals first

questions.text: When plans suddenly change, you typically:

choices.text: Adapt quickly and see new possibilities
Feel frustrated but adjust eventually
Become quite stressed and need time to recalibrate
Immediately start making new plans

questions.text: In a team disagreement, you tend to:

choices.text: Advocate strongly for your position
Look for compromise to maintain harmony
Analyze all perspectives before weighing in
Avoid the conflict and hope it resolves itself

questions.text: Your approach to rules and conventions is:

choices.text: Follow them - they exist for good reasons
Question them and break them when necessary
Respect them publicly but bend them privately
Feel anxious about breaking them even when appropriate

questions.text: After a long, demanding week, you prefer to:

choices.text: Go out with friends to decompress
Spend quiet time alone with a book or hobby
Tackle personal projects you've been putting off
Rest but feel guilty about not being productive

questions.text: When imagining your future, you tend to:

choices.text: Feel excited about many possibilities
Have a clear plan you're working toward
Worry about things that could go wrong
Focus on the present rather than the future

questions.text: When you've made a mistake, you typically:

choices.text: Analyze what went wrong and create systems to prevent it
Apologize quickly and move on
Dwell on it and feel bad for a while
Reframe it as a learning experience

questions.text: In your ideal life, what matters most?

choices.text: Achievement and making an impact
Deep relationships and connection
Freedom and new experiences
Security and peace of mind
